prompt: Create an AGENTS.md for this project. I want future agents to know how to build, test, and navigate the codebase.

assertions.text: An AGENTS.md file exists in the outputs directory
The file contains a section describing the project's directory structure (src/api, src/workers, src/shared)
The file includes build and test commands (e.g., tsc, vitest or the npm script equivalents)
The file mentions the key technologies: TypeScript, Express, Prisma, Redis, BullMQ
The file mentions database migration or seeding commands (prisma migrate, seed)
The file is under 100 lines — a well-written AGENTS.md should be lean and focused
The file does not contain generic filler like 'npm install' as a standalone setup step, or verbose explanations of obvious commands
Commands are formatted as bullet list items (e.g., '- `cmd` — description') rather than headings with code blocks

The file includes at least one project-specific gotcha or convention discovered from reading the source code (e.g., redis.quit() in teardown, transaction patterns in sync-worker, singleton connections)
